conclusion: An electron is injected into a uniform electric field between two parallel metal plates with an initial velocity v0 = 4 × 10^6 m/s from point O.
The electron exits the electric field at point C, forming a 30° angle with the direction of v0.
The charge of the electron is e = 1.6 × 10^-19 C, and the mass of the electron is m = 0.91 × 10^-30 kg.

premise: The electron's initial velocity v0 is along the central line perpendicular to the electric field. The angle with v0 at point C is 30°.
conclusion: The component of velocity v_x at point C is v_x = v0 cos(30°) = 2 × 10^6 √3 m/s.

premise: The electron's initial velocity v0 is along the central line perpendicular to the electric field. The angle with v0 at point C is 30°.
conclusion: The component of velocity v_y at point C is v_y = v0 sin(30°) = 2 × 10^6 m/s.
The magnitude of the velocity v at point C is v = 4 × 10^6 m/s.
The kinetic energy K of the electron at point C is K = 7.28 × 10^-18 J.
